name: Scarborough Fair Bed & Breakfast

reviews.text: I recently returned from a weekend (three night) stay at this wonderfully small and intimate property. I was having a reunion with an old and dear friend. The atmosphere was quiet and private, yet friendly and helpful when needed.
reviews.title: Exceptionally friendly
Great Location, Excellent Inn
reviews.text: Loved the room (Hickory Vale) and the breakfasts. I'm somewhat picky as to my diet and Barry and Jeff went above and beyond to make my breakfast excellent. ( I had eggs one morning whilst the other guests had a carb heavy entree....they went to the extra work to add grape tomatoes and basil that had been experty chopped into a chiffonade.) Lovely touch.
There is a fridge convenient to all guests along with wine glasses and bottled water all for the use of guests.
reviews.title: Fabulous Stay with Barry and Jeff

reviews.text: Wonderful visit! The innkeepers went out of their way to make us feel welcome! Great food, great location, great room.
I definitely would stay there again if we return to Baltimore.
reviews.title: Wonderful B&B

reviews.text: My mother and I recently had the pleasure of spending 2 nites at the Scarborough Fair which is located in the quiet Federal Hill historic district which is just a couple blocks from the busy Inner Harbor area. The accommodations were absolutely lovely. We stayed in the very comfortable Curran Room which has 2 twin beds and a large private bath. The decor of this room, as well as the other rooms we were able to peek at, were impecable. Our host, Barry, who has just purchased the Inn within the last month, could not have been more perfect. He was charming, accommodating, and very knowledgeable of the area and the restaurants. His associate, Claudette, prepared wonderful breakfasts for us and was also has the perfect personality one would expect from B&B Innkeepers. The Inn has use of a parking lot just around the corner which was very convenient. We were so please we chose the Scarborough Fair - it was absolutely charming.
reviews.title: Perfect B&B!

likes.disliked: — The 20 fresh bluberries on my waffle were not enough for me - I could have used 30! But if I had asked - the inkeeper would have accomodated me! ;-)

description: Within 2 blocks of the Inner Harbor, this 1801 Georgian Style Bed and Breakfast has been welcoming guests for 10 years. Walk to most major attractions, including Camden Yards & Ravens Stadium, Baltimore Convention Center, restaurants and shops, the National Aquarium and more. Free Parking, Full Cooked Breakfast, complimentary beverages, afternoon homemade cookies. Spacious bedrooms have private baths (some with jacuzzis and fireplaces). Located in Federal Hill neighborhood.
